title: Depth Meter
summaries: The Depth Meter is an informational accessory that displays the player's depth. Depth is relative to the boundary between the Surface and Underground layers, which has a depth of 0 and is displayed as "Level". The display shows the vertical distance to this line and the name of the current layer. Depth is always measured at the level of the player's feet.

• On the [img:Desktop version] Desktop version, [img:Console version] Console version, and [img:Mobile version] Mobile version, depth is measured in feet, with one tile equaling two feet.
  • On the [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console version, depth is measured in meters, with two tiles equaling one meter.
  • On the Nintendo 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] version, depth is not measured, and the only benefits the accessory grants are from its modifiers.

The Depth Meter has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/100 (1%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/200 (0.5%) chance of being dropped by Cave Bats, Jungle Bats, Ice Bats, Giant Bats, and Spore Bats(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Furthermore, it has a 1/80 (1.25%) chance of being dropped from Crawdads(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Giant Shellies(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Salamanders(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). In the [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console version, the Depth Meter may also be crafted.

The Depth Meter is one of the three parts necessary to make the GPS, with the others being the Compass and the Gold Watch or Platinum Watch, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
